Package net.sawannaniz.databaseclient.dbutils

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sawannaniz.databaseclient.dbutils.Database
  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    It represents and provides a direct interface to Przychodnia database. Its methods are called by instances of classes included in net.sawannaniz.databaseclient.ctrl package.
    Since:
    2023-04-09
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mateusz Marzec

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Database.Role
      List of Roles corresponding to roles defined for a certain MariaDB server and Przychodnia database

      Creates a database object based on username, password, IP address of the database, port, database name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database​(java.lang.String us,
                java.lang.String pwd)
        Creates a database object based on given username and password. The rest of the parameters are implicit for the default Przychodnia database on a cloud server on 172.106.0.62 under port 18601. Also contains access to a default java keystore.
        Parameters:
        us - username
        pwd - password

      • Database

        public Database​(java.lang.String us,
                java.lang.String pwd,
                java.lang.String ad,
                java.lang.String p,
                java.lang.String db,
                java.lang.String sslStr,
                java.lang.String pE)
        Creates a database object based on username, password, IP address of the database, port, database name. Also requires password to java keystore and information about requirement for SSL/TLS protocol when connecting or sending data.
        Parameters:
        us - username
        pwd - password
        ad - IP address of the database
        p - port number
        db - database name - to avoid misunderstanding, this should be "Przychodnia"
        sslStr - whether SSL/TLS protocol is to be used ("YES") or not ("NO");
        pE - entry password to access java keystore (used for SSL/TLS secured connections)

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentDate

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentDate()
        Returns current date in YYYY-MM-DD format.
        Returns:
        datetime in YYYY-MM-DD format

      • checkStringsForProperContent

        public static boolean checkStringsForProperContent​(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> strTable)
        Checks whether a vector of Strings is valid. Valid means that do not contain anything else than letters, digits or spaces.
        Parameters:
        strTable - a vector of Strings to be checked
        Returns:
        whether data is valid or not

      • checkStringsForProperContent

        public static boolean checkStringsForProperContent​(java.lang.String s)
        An overloaded version of the method, it is used for one String only. As above, String should contain nothing more than letters, digits and spaces.
        Parameters:
        s - String to be checked for validity
        Returns:
        whether data is valid

      • removeSecondsFromDatetime

        public static java.lang.String removeSecondsFromDatetime​(java.lang.String s)
        Removes seconds part from datetime. It is used for user-friendly datetime presentation (seconds are useless when making appointments in a clinic). The String should be in a proper datetime format, as this function just removes three last characters (:ss).
        Parameters:
        s - String in a datetime format
        Returns:
        The same string without 3 last characters (seconds part).

      • checkStringForProperDatetime

        public static boolean checkStringForProperDatetime​(java.lang.String s)
        Checks whether the provided String is in a proper datetime format. Proper datetime format means YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS
        Parameters:
        s - The String that will be checked
        Returns:
        whether the format is correct

      • checkStringForICD10

        public static boolean checkStringForICD10​(java.lang.String s)
        Checks whether the String contains a proper ICD-10 code. The required format includes a letter followed by two digits followed by dot and one digit.
        Parameters:
        s - the String that will be checked
        Returns:
        whether data is correct

      • checkStringForIP

        public static boolean checkStringForIP​(java.lang.String s)
        Checks whether the provided String contains valid IP address. Requires IPv4 address format with nothing after the fourth byte.
        Parameters:
        s - the string that will be checked
        Returns:
        whether data is correct

      • addCommas

        public static java.lang.String addCommas​(java.lang.String s)
        Adds parentheses before and after a String. It is useful for making proper SQL queries.
        Parameters:
        s - String to be modified
        Returns:
        The same String after modification

      • convertStringToDatetime

        public static java.lang.String convertStringToDatetime​(java.lang.String s)
        Provides an interface for a MariaDB stored procedure STR_TO_DATE() which converts varchar to datetime.
        Parameters:
        s - String that will become datetime in a database
        Returns:
        String after modification

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Connects to the database. All important parameters for connection are in the object's fields, provided upon its creation.
        Returns:
        whether the operation succeeded or not.

      • determineCurrentRole

        public Database.Role determineCurrentRole​(java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean result)
        Finds a database role of the logged user.
        Parameters:
        result - whether the operation was successful or not is stored in this object
        Returns:
        the role, see Database.Role

      • insert

        public boolean insert​(java.lang.String table,
                      java.lang.String columns,
                      java.lang.String values)
        Inserts something to the database as identified by the parameters.
        Parameters:
        table - which table will be used
        columns - which columns will be involved (separated with commas)
        values - which values will be inserted (separated with commas, meets the columns order)
        Returns:
        whether operation was successful or not

      • delete

        public boolean delete​(java.lang.String table,
                      java.lang.String where)
        Deletes something from the database as identified by the parameters.
        Parameters:
        table - which table will be involved
        where - the conditions that should be met to delete the row (separated with commas)
        Returns:
        whether the operation was successful or not

      • update

        public boolean update​(java.lang.String command,
                      java.lang.String s1,
                      java.lang.String s2,
                      int i1)
        Updates data in a database, as identified by the parameters. Actually it requires an explicit String which will become a prepared statement for two strings and one integer. This method is used only when realizing appointments, as verification of data is then difficult.
        Parameters:
        command - explicit String that will become a prepared statement
        s1 - first string parameter
        s2 - second string parameter
        i1 - integer parameter
        Returns:
        whether the operation was successful or not

      • update

        public boolean update​(java.lang.String table,
                      java.lang.String data,
                      java.lang.String condition)
        An overloaded version of the update() method. Updates the database according to the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        table - table which will be updated
        data - data to be updated, provided in an SQL format parameter = value
        condition - condition for rows to be updated (separated with commas)
        Returns:
        whether the operation was successful or not

      • select

        public java.sql.ResultSet select​(java.lang.String what,
                                 java.lang.String table,
                                 java.lang.String condition,
                                 java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean result)
        Reads data from the database according to the provided parameters.
        Parameters:
        what - which columns are to be retrieved
        table - which table is searched through
        condition - conditions of search (separated with commas)
        result - result of the operation will be stored here
        Returns:
        dataset in a ResultSet format

      • select

        public java.sql.ResultSet select​(java.lang.String what,
                                 java.lang.String table,
                                 java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean result)
        An overloaded version of select() method. Returns all rows (no condition is present).
        Parameters:
        what - columns to be retrieved (separated with commas)
        table - table to be searched through
        result - whether operation succeeded or not is stored here
        Returns:
        dataset in ResultSet format

      • select

        public java.sql.ResultSet select​(java.lang.String cmd,
                                 java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean result)
        An overloaded version of select() method, which requires an explicit SELECT query as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        cmd - String which contains explicit SELECT query
        result - result of the operation will be stored here
        Returns:
        dataset in ResultSet format

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes connection with a database.
